column5: Since I couldn't break 15lbs this summer, anyone got pictures of what I'm trying to catch So what nobody on this board caught a big muskie last year?
My biggest last year! Also my biggest ever! Pushing 25 lbs. I think...
Although musky fishing was tougher in 2006 we did manage to catch some good ones.
Yeah, I'll say you did Bob  You got some good muskie.
Hey Bob that's a beauty. St. Clair ?  Unfortuanately all my pics are on old cameras, Got a Digi last fall, so I plan on putting some pics up on opening day.  I hope.
Those are some montsers... Really gets the blood pumping Remindes me of how sore your arms can get pitching big baits all day come on June Hey pigeon was that a trolling fish or casting?
Since you asked Crusty, It was a casting fish. Hit a Topraider about 40 feet from the boat. First fish on a surface bait. Definately one of my best fishing experiences to date!
Last year I did good on number but not on size. The biggest one is 21 pound chunky.
I only really started focusing on Muskie last year, but had good numbers. this is my PB so far. 42.5in fork length w/18in girth.
Hey Jigger, thats a nice one! Get comfortable with the gil-plate and belly hold and you will get a nicer pic!
Can only guess on the weight of this one, but she was a big girl.

Thanks pigeontroller. I don't have much luck with the gill hold and all the larger fish that I got didn't seem to have a problem being held by the tail. I just make sure the head is over the water incase they freak out. You're right, though. The gill hold makes for much better shots. Thanks again. BTW, Doctrt, thats a BEAUT!

Jigger, it just takes alittle practice, I started with the tail hold too...    One of the great things about a BIG pen net is there's no hurry...Lots of time to get acquainted, just becareful of the Gills and TEETH!
I landed 3 last season, which was my first season targetting them specifically.  A 40", 34", and the monster 50" in my avatar.  I can now hardly think of targetting another species.
